Hi all Kerbal fans 

I have small request from anybody who will tomorrow buy the game and downloaded it. Could you measure size of downloaded package.

I need this because I working on ship and in next port I'm planing to buy appropriate SIM card and I need to know what data package to look for.

I'm planning to buy game not from Epic or Steam but from PD without DRM, but from any of sites would be nice.

Let's G-force be with you

Just now, Kalessin1 said:

Hi all Kerbal fans 

I have small request from anybody who will tomorrow buy the game and downloaded it. Could you measure size of downloaded package.

I need this because I working on ship and in next port I'm planing to buy appropriate SIM card and I need to know what data package to look for.

I'm planning to buy game not from Epic or Steam but from PD without DRM, but from any of sites would be nice.

Let's G-force be with you 

The recommended SSD space is 60 GBs, so I would go with at least 128 gb, possibly 256 if you plan on having tons of mods. 

Remember, the game isn't complete. We don't know if that 60GBs is the full complete build or the actual day one EA size. I would play it safe and get a 128, or even a 256.

The recommended SSD space is 60 GBs, so I would go with at least 128 gb, possibly 256 if you plan on having tons of mods. 

Remember, the game isn't complete. We don't know if that 60GBs is the full complete build or the actual day one EA size. I would play it safe and get a 128, or even a 256.

And I think You where saying about SSD drive size not SIM card data plans  most internet providers do not use 128, 256, etc size of data plans.
